item.title: Pystyy vetää
item.description: We are a open CTF team from Winland, welcoming all who are interested in CTF to join us and learn together. Everyone from a beginner to a seasoned veteran is welcome. Pystyy vetää aims to lower the barrier of entry for CTF events and to enable a more casual approach to participating. You don’t need to commit to allnighters or be a reverse engineering wizard to feel welcome. We cherish our inclusive atmosphere, and harrassment isn’t tolerated.

item.title: Writeup: nullcon HackIM 2019 - 2FUN
item.description: Idea of the challenge was to use Meet-in-the-middle attack. Basically instead of trying all combinations of 48-bit keys, we generate all possible outputs from encryption function with 24-bit key and plaintext 16 bit plaintext and also generate all possible outputs from decryption function with 24-bit key and ciphertext \x04\x67\xa5\x2a\xfa\x8f\x15\xcf\xb8\xf0\xea\x40\x36\x5a\x66\x92. We then try to find equal output from the collection of the encrypted output and from the decrypted output, representating the “ct1”-variable of the given code.

item.title: Writeup: nullcon HackIM 2019 - 0bfusc8 Much
item.description: Writeup of reverse engineering challenge “0bfusc8 Much”. Check it out at Tommi’s site: https://www.rouvali.com/?page_id=205
